20  package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor;
21  
22  import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
23  
24  import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
25  import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
26  import org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration;
27  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.*;
28  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HTable;
29  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Put;
30  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Scan;
31  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.coprocessor.AggregationClient;
32  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.coprocessor.LongColumnInterpreter;
33  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.Filter;
34  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.PrefixFilter;
35  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Bytes;
36  import org.junit.AfterClass;
37  import org.junit.BeforeClass;
38  import org.junit.Test;
39  import org.junit.experimental.categories.Category;
40  
41  /**
42   * A test class to cover aggregate functions, that can be implemented using
43   * Coprocessors.
44   */
45  @Category(MediumTests.class)
46  public class TestAggregateProtocol {
47    protected static Log myLog = LogFactory.getLog(TestAggregateProtocol.class);
48  
49    /**
50     * Creating the test infrastructure.
51     */
52    private static final byte[] TEST_TABLE = Bytes.toBytes("TestTable");
53    private static final byte[] TEST_FAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("TestFamily");
54    private static final byte[] TEST_QUALIFIER = Bytes.toBytes("TestQualifier");
55    private static final byte[] TEST_MULTI_CQ = Bytes.toBytes("TestMultiCQ");
56  
57    private static byte[] ROW = Bytes.toBytes("testRow");
58    private static final int ROWSIZE = 20;
59    private static final int rowSeperator1 = 5;
60    private static final int rowSeperator2 = 12;
61    private static byte[][] ROWS = makeN(ROW, ROWSIZE);
62  
63    private static HBaseTestingUtility util = new HBaseTestingUtility();
64    private static Configuration conf = util.getConfiguration();
65  
66    /**
67     * A set up method to start the test cluster. AggregateProtocolImpl is
68     * registered and will be loaded during region startup.
69     * @throws Exception
70     */
71    @BeforeClass
72    public static void setupBeforeClass() throws Exception {
73  
74      conf.set(CoprocessorHost.REGION_COPROCESSOR_CONF_KEY,
75          "org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.AggregateImplementation");
76  
77      util.startMiniCluster(2);
78      HTable table = util.createTable(TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY);
79      util.createMultiRegions(util.getConfiguration(), table, TEST_FAMILY,
80          new byte[][] { HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, ROWS[rowSeperator1],
81              ROWS[rowSeperator2] });
82      /**
83       * The testtable has one CQ which is always populated and one variable CQ
84       * for each row rowkey1: CF:CQ CF:CQ1 rowKey2: CF:CQ CF:CQ2
85       */
86      for (int i = 0; i < ROWSIZE; i++) {
87        Put put = new Put(ROWS[i]);
88        put.setWriteToWAL(false);
89        Long l = new Long(i);
90        put.add(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER, Bytes.toBytes(l));
91        table.put(put);
92        Put p2 = new Put(ROWS[i]);
93        put.setWriteToWAL(false);
94        p2.add(TEST_FAMILY, Bytes.add(TEST_MULTI_CQ, Bytes.toBytes(l)), Bytes
95            .toBytes(l * 10));
96        table.put(p2);
97      }
98      table.close();
99    }
100 
101   /**
102    * Shutting down the cluster
103    * @throws Exception
104    */
105   @AfterClass
106   public static void tearDownAfterClass() throws Exception {
107     util.shutdownMiniCluster();
108   }
109 
110   /**
111    * an infrastructure method to prepare rows for the testtable.
112    * @param base
113    * @param n
114    * @return
115    */
116   private static byte[][] makeN(byte[] base, int n) {
117     byte[][] ret = new byte[n][];
118     for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
119       ret[i] = Bytes.add(base, Bytes.toBytes(i));
120     }
121     return ret;
122   }
123 
124   /**
125    * ****************** Test cases for Median **********************
126    */
127   /**
128    * @throws Throwable
129    */
130   @Test
131   public void testMedianWithValidRange() throws Throwable {
132     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
133     Scan scan = new Scan();
134     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY,TEST_QUALIFIER);
135     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
136     long median = aClient.median(TEST_TABLE, ci,
137         scan);
138     assertEquals(8L, median);
139   }
140 
141   /**
142    * **************************** ROW COUNT Test cases *******************
143    */
144 
145   /**
146    * This will test rowcount with a valid range, i.e., a subset of rows. It will
147    * be the most common use case.
148    * @throws Throwable
149    */
150   @Test
151   public void testRowCountWithValidRange() throws Throwable {
152     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
153     Scan scan = new Scan();
154     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER);
155     scan.setStartRow(ROWS[2]);
156     scan.setStopRow(ROWS[14]);
157     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
158     long rowCount = aClient.rowCount(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
159     assertEquals(12, rowCount);
160   }
161 
162   /**
163    * This will test the row count on the entire table. Startrow and endrow will
164    * be null.
165    * @throws Throwable
166    */
167   @Test
168   public void testRowCountAllTable() throws Throwable {
169     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
170     Scan scan = new Scan();
171     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER);
172     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
173     long rowCount = aClient.rowCount(TEST_TABLE, ci,
174         scan);
175     assertEquals(ROWSIZE, rowCount);
176   }
177 
178   /**
179    * This will test the row count with startrow > endrow. The result should be
180    * -1.
181    * @throws Throwable
182    */
183   @Test
184   public void testRowCountWithInvalidRange1() {
185     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
186     Scan scan = new Scan();
187     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER);
188     scan.setStartRow(ROWS[5]);
189     scan.setStopRow(ROWS[2]);
190 
191     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
192     long rowCount = -1;
193     try {
194       rowCount = aClient.rowCount(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
195     } catch (Throwable e) {
196       myLog.error("Exception thrown in the invalidRange method"
197           + e.getStackTrace());
198     }
199     assertEquals(-1, rowCount);
200   }
201 
202   /**
203    * This will test the row count with startrow = endrow and they will be
204    * non-null. The result should be 0, as it assumes a non-get query.
205    * @throws Throwable
206    */
207   @Test
208   public void testRowCountWithInvalidRange2() {
209     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
210     Scan scan = new Scan();
211     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER);
212     scan.setStartRow(ROWS[5]);
213     scan.setStopRow(ROWS[5]);
214 
215     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
216     long rowCount = -1;
217     try {
218       rowCount = aClient.rowCount(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
219     } catch (Throwable e) {
220       rowCount = 0;
221     }
222     assertEquals(0, rowCount);
223   }
224 
225   /**
226    * This should return a 0
227    */
228   @Test
229   public void testRowCountWithNullCF() {
230     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
231     Scan scan = new Scan();
232     scan.setStartRow(ROWS[5]);
233     scan.setStopRow(ROWS[15]);
234     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
235     long rowCount = -1;
236     try {
237       rowCount = aClient.rowCount(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
238     } catch (Throwable e) {
239        rowCount = 0;
240     }
241     assertEquals(0, rowCount);
242   }
243 
244   @Test
245   public void testRowCountWithNullCQ() throws Throwable {
246     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
247     Scan scan = new Scan();
248     scan.addFamily(TEST_FAMILY);
249     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
250     long rowCount = aClient.rowCount(TEST_TABLE, ci,
251         scan);
252     assertEquals(20, rowCount);
253   }
254 
255   @Test
256   public void testRowCountWithPrefixFilter() throws Throwable {
257     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
258     Scan scan = new Scan();
259     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER);
260     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
261     Filter f = new PrefixFilter(Bytes.toBytes("foo:bar"));
262     scan.setFilter(f);
263     long rowCount = aClient.rowCount(TEST_TABLE, ci,
264         scan);
265     assertEquals(0, rowCount);
266   }

322 
323   @Test
324   public void testMaxWithValidRangeWithNullCF() {
325     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
326     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
327     Scan scan = new Scan();
328     Long max = null;
329     try {
330       max = aClient.max(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
331     } catch (Throwable e) {
332       max = null;
333     }
334     assertEquals(null, max);// CP will throw an IOException about the
335     // null column family, and max will be set to 0
336   }
337 
338   @Test
339   public void testMaxWithInvalidRange() {
340     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
341     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
342     Scan scan = new Scan();
343     scan.setStartRow(ROWS[4]);
344     scan.setStopRow(ROWS[2]);
345     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER);
346     long max = Long.MIN_VALUE;
347     try {
348       max = aClient.max(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
349     } catch (Throwable e) {
350       max = 0;
351     }
352     assertEquals(0, max);// control should go to the catch block
353   }
354 
355   @Test
356   public void testMaxWithInvalidRange2() throws Throwable {
357     long max = Long.MIN_VALUE;
358     Scan scan = new Scan();
359     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER);
360     scan.setStartRow(ROWS[4]);
361     scan.setStopRow(ROWS[4]);
362     try {
363       AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
364       final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
365       max = aClient.max(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
366     } catch (Exception e) {
367       max = 0;
368     }
369     assertEquals(0, max);// control should go to the catch block
370   }
371 
372   @Test
373   public void testMaxWithFilter() throws Throwable {
374     Long max = 0l;
375     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
376     Scan scan = new Scan();
377     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER);
378     Filter f = new PrefixFilter(Bytes.toBytes("foo:bar"));
379     scan.setFilter(f);
380     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
381     max = aClient.max(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
382     assertEquals(null, max);
383   }

397     scan.setStartRow(HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW);

400     Long min = aClient.min(TEST_TABLE, ci,

538   @Test
539   public void testSumWithValidRangeWithNoCQ() throws Throwable {
540     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
541     Scan scan = new Scan();
542     scan.addFamily(TEST_FAMILY);
543     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
544     long sum = aClient.sum(TEST_TABLE, ci,
545         scan);
546     assertEquals(190 + 1900, sum);
547   }

661   @Test
662   public void testAvgWithValidRangeWithNullCF() {
663     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
664     Scan scan = new Scan();
665     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
666     Double avg = null;
667     try {
668       avg = aClient.avg(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
669     } catch (Throwable e) {
670     }
671     assertEquals(null, avg);// CP will throw an IOException about the
672     // null column family, and max will be set to 0
673   }
674 
675   @Test
676   public void testAvgWithInvalidRange() {
677     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
678     Scan scan = new Scan();
679     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY,TEST_QUALIFIER);
680     scan.setStartRow(ROWS[5]);
681     scan.setStopRow(ROWS[1]);
682     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
683     Double avg = null;
684     try {
685       avg = aClient.avg(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
686     } catch (Throwable e) {
687     }
688     assertEquals(null, avg);// control should go to the catch block
689   }

691   @Test
692   public void testAvgWithFilter() throws Throwable {
693     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
694     Scan scan = new Scan();
695     scan.addColumn(TEST_FAMILY,TEST_QUALIFIER);
696     Filter f = new PrefixFilter(Bytes.toBytes("foo:bar"));
697     scan.setFilter(f);
698     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
699     Double avg = null;
700     avg = aClient.avg(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
701     assertEquals(Double.NaN, avg, 0);
702   }

791   @Test
792   public void testStdWithFilter() throws Throwable {
793     AggregationClient aClient = new AggregationClient(conf);
794     Filter f = new PrefixFilter(Bytes.toBytes("foo:bar"));
795     Scan scan = new Scan();
796     scan.addFamily(TEST_FAMILY);
797     scan.setFilter(f);
798     final ColumnInterpreter<Long, Long> ci = new LongColumnInterpreter();
799     Double std = null;
800     std = aClient.std(TEST_TABLE, ci, scan);
801     assertEquals(Double.NaN, std, 0);
802   }
